description:
About the Company

Our client is a leading international drug discovery and development services partner offering a comprehensive suite of integrated capabilities for its clients. The company has >100 co-owned potential product opportunities and over 15 partnered internal programs and provides its services on a typical fee-for-service basis or through a preferred model of commercial structures including research fees, milestones, and/or royalties.

Years in Business: 25+ years
Employees: 3000+

About the Opportunity

The Vice President/SVP of Business Development (VP) will be at the epicenter of the evolving R&D Partnership landscape and critical in helping identify, evaluate, and weigh in on opportunities in the marketplace. The VP must be able to create both short-term and long-term value establishing long-term mutually beneficial relationships with partners, specifically within the broader drug discovery market. The role will have wide-ranging exposure to a variety of therapeutic partnerships and expansive drug discovery platforms regularly interfacing with Scientific Operations teams, Therapeutic Area leads, Alliance Management, and Senior Management. This individual should have a strong understanding of the requirements and challenges of drug discovery and development, a desire for frequent interaction with customers by being visible in the marketplace, and a strong track record in developing, mentoring, and managing other business development professionals.
• Reporting to: Senior VP, Business Development
• Preferred Employee Location: Boston, MA
• Compensation: Based on Experience
• Benefits: Medical (company pays 92% of premium), Dental & Vision, 401(k) with company match, LTI

What’s stands out the most about this opportunity?
• The company is a renowned leader in the industry and a consistent innovator
• Average tenure across the BD team is over 7 years
• First company to create a model for both services and co-owned pipeline
• More than 3,000 highly qualified employees at 10+ sites in the US, Europe, and UK
• Competitive compensation package
• Established, publicly-traded, mid-sized company

You should consider this if:
• You have 10+ years of direct business development experience within pharma/biotech/CRO/CDMO
• You can demonstrate a history of success closing large, strategic transactions (in/out licensing, multi-year programs, integrated programs, milestone deals, etc.)
• You enjoy operating in a collaborative environment
• You are confident and capable working independently and as part of a team
• You have 3+ years managing other business development professionals
• You have a minimum of a Bachelors in a Life Sciences related field, advanced degree preferred

For more detailed information please inquire or contact one of the team members below.
